title: About
text:
My name is Darren Lin. I’m a first year master’s student in the biostatistics department at Johns Hopkins University. I was also an undergraduate at Johns Hopkins, where I majored in applied mathematics and public health.
In my free time, I enjoy exploring Baltimore and trying new things. I recently got into bouldering, which is really fun!

title: Example Analysis
text:
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
library(dplyr)
library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthdata)
library("maps")

bigfoot_data <- tt_load('2022-09-13')


    Downloading file 1 of 1: `bigfoot.csv`

bigfoot <- bigfoot_data$bigfoot


weather <- bigfoot %>%
  select(season, visibility) %>%
  drop_na()

ggplot(weather, aes(season)) +
  geom_bar()





location <- bigfoot %>%
  select(latitude, longitude, state) %>%
  filter(state != "Alaska", state != "Hawaii") %>%
  distinct() %>%
  drop_na()

MainStates <- map_data("state")
ggplot() + 
  geom_polygon(data=MainStates, aes(x=long, y=lat, group=group),
                color="black", fill="lightblue" ) +
  geom_point(data = location, aes(x = longitude, y = latitude), size = 1, 
        shape = 23, fill = "darkred") +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(-125, -70), ylim = c(25, 50))





location <- bigfoot %>%
  select(state) %>%
  count(state, sort = TRUE) 
head(location)

# A tibble: 6 × 2
  state          n
  <chr>      <int>
1 Washington   601
2 California   417
3 Ohio         303
4 Florida      302
5 Oregon       249
6 Illinois     237
